## Linear Model 

```{r}
#removed id, name, host_id, host_name, and last_review
#too many unique values
lin1 <- lm(price ~ neighbourhood_group + neighbourhood + latitude + longitude + room_type + minimum_nights + number_of_reviews + reviews_per_month + calculated_host_listings_count + availability_365, data=train)
anova(lin1)
```

## Reduced linear model

```{r}
#remove insiginifocant variables from lin1, removed neighbourhood bc of error
lin2 <- lm(price ~ neighbourhood_group  + longitude + room_type + minimum_nights + number_of_reviews + availability_365, data=train)
anova(lin2)
```

### checking MSE

```{r}
linpred <- predict(lin2,newdata=train)
lin_mse <- mean((linpred - train$price)^2)
lin_mse


```

MSE is awful

## LASSO 

### finding lambda
```{r}
library(glmnet)
trainmat <- model.matrix(price ~ neighbourhood_group + neighbourhood + latitude + longitude + room_type + minimum_nights + number_of_reviews + reviews_per_month + calculated_host_listings_count + availability_365, data = train)
#testmat <- model.matrix(price ~ neighbourhood_group + neighbourhood + latitude + longitude + room_type + minimum_nights + number_of_reviews + reviews_per_month + calculated_host_listings_count + availability_365, data = test)
summary(train)
summary(trainmat)
cv = cv.glmnet(trainmat, train$price, alpha = 1)
plot(cv)
lammy <- cv$lambda.min
lammy
```

### fitting model

```{r}
lasso <- glmnet(trainmat, train$price, alpha = 1,lambda = lammy)
coef(lasso)
```

### checking MSE

```{r}
lasso_preddy <- predict(lasso, s=lammy, newx=testmat)
lasso_mse <- mean((lasso_preddy - test$price)^2)
lasso_mse
```

rf1
